website_summaries.verdict: A great bet for the price, but a few customers mention the bottom plastic cracks and breaks over time.
pros: A staggered four-blade system keeps chopping consistent, and the simple construction makes it easy to use
cons: A handful of customers complain of food getting stuck under the blade

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job choppin' but...
customer_reviews.text: At first this was a blessing! It chops amazingly, but what really bugs me is that on the little connector to the blade, there's a little circular indentation certain foods can slip in when you're pureeing or super finely chopiing, and it's so thin, it's really difficult to get out, and it's like 3/4 of an inch deep.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Andres Mayoral

customer_reviews.title: Great for medium sized chopping and blending jobs not for small or individual amounts
customer_reviews.text: This is great when you have a fair amount to chop, such as making a salsa dip, but if you want to chop up a small or single serving amounts, such as a few cloves of garlic, the bottom blades are to high up and they don't get close enough to the container to catch the smaller pieces so you end up with large chunky pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Benher

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back...
customer_reviews.text: The first time that I used this little processor, food became stuck in between the motor head and the gear that spins the blades. I looked everywhere for how to clean that area, but all the instructions said was "not to submerge in water". They gave no instructions on how to clean between the gears. I don't really want left-over food for the next time that I use the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Cozy

customer_reviews.title: Good for Puree, Not for Chop
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the NINJA EXPRESS CHOP. I think they should remove "chop" from the name. I was looking for a vegetable chopper, but the Ninja Express Chop is more like an insta-puree machine. I tried pulsing only once or twice, but that just leaves you with half pureed veggies and half huge, clunky veggies. The blades pretty much liquefy anything they touch. If you're looking for something to puree/liquefy, this thing works like a champ. But if you want just to chop veggies, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: FancyPance

customer_reviews.title: Smoke and then stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this product it would have helped tremendously but after five days of using it for nothing but fruits and vegetables the top started smoking and then it stopped working
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D.

customer_reviews.title: First used was great, second killed it
customer_reviews.text: First use was to chop up some veggies and spices for chili, worked great. Easy to clean and I like the storage lid, Pulled it out today for second use, after about 20 seconds, started to made a really bad squealing sound, then a smacking sound. Sure enough I pulled the blade out to find it had melted the bottom and the blade was hitting the sides, I had to throw away the food that was contaminated with plastic. my little old food processor worked for years, and was bought used. This one I had for 2 months and used twice.
customer_reviews.author: MoonMan

customer_reviews.title: Loved this food processor until just recently I went to ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved this food processor until just recently I went to use it and the motor started smoking and would not turn on. I have only used it about 6 times which is really a shame because it was working great every other time I had used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer - Donna

customer_reviews.title: Plastic will crack with use
customer_reviews.text: Works great but the item could be stronger over all. The bottom floor of my Ninja express has starting cracking from the center (where the blade meets the bottom of the cup) outwards.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Updated review: Ninja no longer works
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product at first. It worked great and was very easy to use. I have to update my review now. I have had this for only a few months and now it no longer works. I have only used it to mix powdered protein drinks with water and a sliced banana. The window has passed for me to return this. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: artist

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t even begin to describe how much I love this chopper. It is worth it for how easily it minces onions! I use it all the time to chop food for my 10-month old daughter. It’s great for quickly chopping up anything for her! Such a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: A great deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use when my blender wouldn’t cut it. It does a great job of chopping veggies and sort of ventures into food processor territory. Before I bought my food processor I would Ninja the dry and wet ingredients separately and the combine them in small batches. This doesn’t work all the time, that’s why I bought my food processor! But it handles small chopping, dicing and mixing jobs very well. It’s super easy to assemble/take apart and cleaning takes literally seconds. There’s a YouTube video review of this food chopper which ime exaggerates its functionality. But at $20 it’s a great deal as long as you take its limitations in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah X

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE! TOP QUALITY, GREAT PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: I can't cook without this! I ordered this after my last one got pretty banged up. So yes this is my second one. The first one lasted 3 years, with HEAVY use! I chop just about everything, onions, carrots, celery, tomato, garlic. This saves me so much time! It's so easy to use. Just chop smaller so that it fits in the cup, then place the lid and put the top motor on top. From there, just press the button down. BUY THIS! It will save you so much time with food prep. GREAT QUALITY, GREAT PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: Cin

customer_reviews.title: Seems cheap
customer_reviews.text: It has already "missed gears" and made a horrible grinding sound. I thought this was a step up from the $10 models that last a year or so, I expect this to break the plastic gears. As usual, one gets what one pays for. Due to the level of dependancy I have on electric choppers I should have bought a professional model. The blending power would be fine but the cheap plastic gears will not stand up to the torque for long. I chopped very ripe garden tomatoes and it slipped gears. Typical Chinese quality although I am not sure where it was made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started Smoking, Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Initially, this worked the way you would expect. But the design of the top portion, while pretty, is NOT PRACTICAL. Everything about the top is rounded or unbalanced so there’s no foolproof way to set the top portion down while you check the main bowl without it rolling on itself and vrooming away from you. Would have been SO simple for them to design it so that it catches on an edge so you can set it on the counter safely. After a week of mild use, it started smoking from the wire portion, struggling to rotate, and stopped working - on YOGURT, ALMOND MILK, AND FROZEN BERRIES. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Yang

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't be without it!
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to eat/chew meat of any kind. When I went into rehab after coming out of the hospital, they had one of these for patients like me. To my amazement, they showed it to me and said Amazon would carry it. When I returned home, I immediately ordered one and it came the next day or so. I love it and am so happy that I can eat meat again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cozens4855

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Items
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little product but only for small items like small onions, canned chicken, tomatoes, etc. It is NOT a full service food processor but does well on making chicken salad. Comes apart easily. All except the motor part is dishwasher safe but it's easy to just hand wash. DO NOT touch the blades! Does not crush ice and should not be used with hot food. Let it cool first. Compact machine at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Speedbyrd

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, wee bit hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: It's a VERY good product. ESPECIALLY in it's price range. I have been using it for almost a month now. It grates very well. Only drawback is the motor hole where food tends to get into, BUT if you clean it then and there its no trouble. So if you're using it, make sure you clean the motor head right away. ALSO, the blade is SUPER sharp, so be very careful. Another thing I noticed is it warms up if you use it for a prolonged period.
customer_reviews.author: Omkar P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great---just don't touch the blades
customer_reviews.text: Make sure that you install the razor-sharp blade assembly BEFORE you add anything you want to chop. I cut up an onion and put a few pieces into the unit before I tried to insert the blade assembly. The blade assembly needs the full length of the housing and must be seated on a plastic tab at the bottom of the housing. I had not noticed the plastic tab and when I tried to insert the blade assembly I barely pressed on the upper blade and received a fairly deep cut on my finger. The unit worked fine once I removed the onion pieces, washed out the blood, and inserted the blade assembly FIRST.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miles

customer_reviews.title: Just ugh!
customer_reviews.text: This chopper is fairly inexpensive and it chops well, if you like your chopped food basically pureed, that is. So why my 1-star review? Because it's impossible to keep the attachment area to the motor clean. It gets food up into the attachment every single time one uses it. And it's impossible to clean well. Not to mention, it attaches to the motor, so you can't put it into water or the dishwasher. Why do so many rate this so highly? Why does Amazon give it best buy rating? Do they LIKE putrified food-stuff in every subsequent chopping of additional food? I just don't get it!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: CAUGHT A FIRE AFTER 4 TIMES OF USING
customer_reviews.text: I used it 3-4 times and after few second of chopping it got broken - the engine caught a fire, there was a strong burn smell and it's not working anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little thing
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this little thing is powerful. Way more than I expected for size and price. Originally got it for baby food as volumes to small for our vitamix, but ave been reaching for this more! Only thing is it’s easy to forget to put the top in before you blend and then the little crevices get absolutely full of food, which is a huge hassle to clean. Otherwise love it! We even packed vitamix away quite early before a move because this is more than enough for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Yasmin Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: A LOT'A BANG FOR THE BUCK !
customer_reviews.text: Being an owner of other Ninja products, when I had to replace my old chopper, it was a no-brainer to choose the Ninja. My first Ninja purchase was over 15 years ago and it's used every week in my kitchen with not a single problem yet! I got the black chopper to match with my blender because they will both be on my counter tops all the time. Of course I had to take it for a 'spin' before submitting this review so....DINNER'S ON !
customer_reviews.author: Laurece

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: I quickly learned to hold the top in place before I pulse, or the whole device spins. Stable though, with a no-skid base. It only takes a tap or two to mince the onion, or green pepper, or celery to the small but course sizes I like. I do cut them into a few uniform pieces first. I also use the chopper to make small smoothies, using frozen berries, Greek yogurt, honey, and a bit of milk. I immediately rinse the blade after every use. Easy enough. I wipe the part that connects to the motor. The base and lid get washed after I empty chilled leftover smoothies. Banished my blender in favor of this Ninja chopper.
customer_reviews.author: LikesGoodDesign

customer_reviews.title: Does the job on smallish amounts so you don't have to lug your big processor out
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, not bad at all. A good size if you're making a small or even medium amount of something and don't feel like dragging your big processor out of the pantry. Not as good as the expensive variable-speed processors, but nice for the price. Seems decently made, has four blades, pulses sturdily, chops/minces quickly. Only drawback I can see is that it doesn't chop/mince 100% evenly, and consequently the bottom half of the contents gets a bit more thorough workout than the top. You can take the cover off and nudge the food down and pulse again, or you can say The heck with it.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of power! I used it to crush cookies for my cheesecake crust. I ground up gingersnaps and then lemon cookies and the crumbs were all perfectly ground up, no cookie pieces to fish out like when I use a large food processor. I thought it was an attachment for my Ninja blender, but it is stand alone. It held about 1 1/2 cups of cookie crumbs I have not tried chopping anything else.
customer_reviews.author: matret

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product with a major food getting stuck in the motor flaw
customer_reviews.text: The product is great for small chopping and purée. I have now been using this for a week and I see a major problem . The food particles get stuck in the motor nozzle . I have tried all possible ways to clean that but it’s just stuck . I can see them and it’s just disgusting to put it back and use it for the next use . Who knows if the yesterdays purée will get mixed with today’s chopping . I have now stopped using it . I do not want to return this product because it functions amazingly but I’m left with no choice to return it .
customer_reviews.author: siddharth

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this blender!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how amazing this blender is. I use it every morning for smoothies, and I put a LOT in my smoothies. Seeds, nuts, frozen fruit, leafy greens, avocados, etc. This thing can handle it all, and it blends it to smooth perfection. I can pack everything in the night before, put the cover on, throw it in the fridge, and just blend it up the next morning. It’s also SO easy to clean. I never use this to chop (that’s what my knives are for) so I can’t speak to that function. But if you need an easy-to-clean blender for shakes and smoothies, this is the best!
customer_reviews.author: melissa stewart

customer_reviews.title: I like the functionality of this chopper however food gets stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: plastic cracked after few months of use. Not a study product. I like the functionality of this chopper however food gets stuck inside the top cover which you cannot submerge in water. So one star less for that.
customer_reviews.author: TeenieMartini84

customer_reviews.title: Guess What? Seems Improved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these before from Target, and then returned it when it cracked near the blade spindle. I missed it so much I decided to purchase one from Amazon. Looks very much like it has been reinforced with an extra thickness of hard plastic near the blade spindle. Easy to use, easy to clean and pulses much better than the similar sized Cuisinart, which leaks if you try to use it to puree. Also, the price is lower, so I bought the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia R.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet little chopper. First time I've ever purchased a Ninja and now I understand what all the hype is about. This is new favorite kitchen appliance. * Chops extremely well * Easy to use * Easy to clean * Small in size and easy to storre w/o taking up too much cabinet space.
customer_reviews.author: Giltzer

customer_reviews.title: Makes food prep 10000% easier and faster
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely feel obliged to write a review on products I purchase, however this thing is AMAZING! I got into cooking at home about 2 years ago and up until now I’d been cutting everything by hand, not anymore! Seriously the best money I’ve ever spent and it makes cooking way more enjoyable now that my hands don’t smell like garlic and whatever else I’m cutting up.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Bottom cracks.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this, I’ve have three now and all of them have cracked at the bottom. The company send me another cup and it cracked too. When it cracks liquid comes out the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherSM87

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Isn't Messing Around
customer_reviews.text: I'm willing to bet that it could grind concrete if I put it in there. It purees chicken breasts in about 3 seconds. I have 2 Ninja items, and I'll never buy another brand of cutting or chopping appliances. WOW.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Oh, Go Ninja!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Ok so as soon as it arrived... Salsa time. I couldn’t believe it and I am not exaggerating. Within seconds what was whole was now finely chopped. I mean seconds. One last thing. The other chopper I used would always leave unchopped pieces. Which meant you had to keep trying eventually making the rest over chopped. Oh go Ninja!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Perks DJ Bobby P

customer_reviews.title: Motor on Top=Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite feature of certain Ninja products has been the motor on top. This makes cleaning a breeze, as the motor and plug aren't at risk of getting wet, like Oster or Hamilton Beech units where a good cleaning of the base requires a toothbrush. I can simply rinse the cup and blade and move on with my prep. For that reason alone, I have gotten more use out of this piece in the last few weeks than any prior choppers that were relegated to the back of the shelf. Powerful little chopper. Power button fits nicely under palm of hand. Feels more ergonomic than the sticky, small button on other products. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Losribeiros

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BLENDER
customer_reviews.text: BEST CHOPPER EVER!!! I hesitated to buy yet ANOTHER appliance, because don’t we all have too many already that go unused? But I do not regret this purchase. I have used it multiple times a week since buying. It is small and doesn’t take up much space in the cabinet. It is so simple and easy to use. I have used it to chop onions, cheese, carrots and jalapenos. I have also used it as a blender to make pesto. It is much easier to use for those sorts of things than my Vitamix or my bulky Cuisinart food processor that has a million parts. The parts fit on the top rack of my dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Sam K.

customer_reviews.title: Puréed, diced, liquified, but not chopped.
customer_reviews.text: Chopping is really not an option. 1 pulse kinda chops what’s at the bottom. 2nd pulse shreds what’s at the bottom and dices the middle. Give it a good shake, and on the 3rd pulse, you get lots of really tiny bits and a couple of untouched chunks. When they say ‘no mush’ they mean mush in nano-seconds. But if you literally can’t dice and chop, like me, You can make it work.
customer_reviews.author: DD B Lerner

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job of chopping vegetables and herbs
customer_reviews.text: We make salads daily but were spending too much time chopping vegetables and herbs by hand. We've tried our full sized food processor and other kitchen gadgets, but the Ninja is the clear winner. We found that as long as you chop vegetables in small batches using short pulses we could achieve some uniformity. With herbs we found that if they are dried after washing the result is also good. The powerful motor and well designed blade really helps the Ninja work better than other devices. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 not 4 like stated and in the picture.
customer_reviews.text: I only received one chopper even though it stated and showed a pack of four. I ended up returning it and purchasing one from Target for $19.99. It does exactly what it supposed to and we’ve had no issues. I wouldn't but this lack of 4 because you'll only get one...i wanted experience rqs to give as gifts but that was a no go.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Upton

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Until It Doesn't
customer_reviews.text: As many others have noted, the hole where the stem for the cutter goes in wears out and the thing makes a terrible grinding noise while it slips. This thing is practically new with very little use.
customer_reviews.author: MrBigAxe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing to make baby food
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, no need to buy the $200 products available to puree baby food. I bought this for $20 and it’s been a game changer to purée or mince food for my 10 month old. It can purée and lightly chop and mince just the right texture for baby. I use this everyday. My favorite part is how super easy it is to clean. There’s only 3 parts to it that need cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Great For Doing Small Chops
customer_reviews.text: For its size, it is a great food processor, easy to clean. If you just need some nuts or herbs chopped up quickly, this is the best. For things like soft cheese though you have to be careful because it doesn’t have the torque. It will overheat and stop working for 10 minutes if you push it too hard.
customer_reviews.author: T.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me cook so much more healthy, I had terrible knife skills and now this item chops my onions, mushrooms, carrots, cucumber ect ... My only complaint is that there is no low or high button, it just chops based on how long you hold the pulse. So in seconds my tomato is salsa or tomato mush soup rather than diced tomatoes. It is super strong, love it for veggies but it is almost to power for over 1 second of use with ripe and fresh fruits.
customer_reviews.author: JoeSacramento

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design.... but Magic Bullet or Nutribullet instead
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. Power cord is connected to the top (blender) component instead of the base. And the top component gets food and spice stick in the column which is impossible to clean. You end up trying to clean it in the sink with the power electrical cord danglining around while you do it. Buy the Magic Bullet or Nutri Bullet instead. I used to have one but misplaced it when I moved and bought this instead because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and poor quality plastic. Awful. Maybe defective?
customer_reviews.text: This product cut fine the first time I used it, however, the first time I washed it, I left it to soak with my other dishes after running my dish water. The bottom clear portion deformed heavily, and now the product is unusable. DO NOT wash this in hot water if you buy it, and god help you if you forget and throw it in with the rest of the stuff. I even read reviews that said it was dishwasher safe, and this wasn't even in a dish washer. It's awful. If it was more sturdy, it seemed like it would be a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: FOOD PROCESSOR OR BLENDER?
customer_reviews.text: It's both! chops onions, garlic, nuts, greens, fruits. I used this to chop onions and garlic and occasionally smoothies. It cuts into frozen fruits well. The blades are really sharp and the product as a whole is easy to clean. You just push down on that top button and it blends. The bottom of the bowl compartment has a slight suction thing that sticks to the counter so don't worry about slippage. 10/10 affordable and efficient blender/food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT TAKE A CHANCE ON THIS CHOPPER
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this chopper it worked fine. Later the same day I tried to use it again and it wouldn't work. I tried everything the manual and customer service said to do but it still wouldn't work. I was told I could send it back prepaid but would have to pay either $9.95 or $19.95 to have a new unit sent to me. I couldn't understand the dollar amount due to the customer service reps strong accent. That is ridiculous. I bought a Ninja because I thought they were supposed to be good.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Gal

customer_reviews.title: Plastic base with cracks!
customer_reviews.text: Plastic base developed cracks after 8 months of routine use. This is our 2nd Ninja chopper with the same problem. I will not be buying it any more.
customer_reviews.author: Knight

customer_reviews.title: Saving many minutes in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This has made chopping onions a dream. Mincing garlic only works if it is a considerable amount. This does purée after longer than a few seconds or pulses, but it is not strong enough to really process harder foods, such as chocolate chips or black beans for black bean brownies or as the beans I used were not smooth. This also gets warm after some use and the motor starts to smell, but overall I am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Works great and the size is convenient
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought it would be but dang does this baby work. My old food processor of 10yrs bit there dust and I needed solely quick to make my daughter's smoothies, the kid will not eat fruit/vegetables Otherwise 🙄. I was weary at first but have it a shot and am not disappointed! Use it daily for other little things. Pop it in the dishwasher. It's great. I don't miss my old clunky food processor at all! Love this little guy!
customer_reviews.author: Mnky

customer_reviews.title: The best chopper we have ever had...
customer_reviews.text: OMG...this chopper is the bomb! It makes short work of any chopping chores. For a coarse chop, just a pulse or two gets it done. For finer chop, we run it for a few seconds. Every time I use it, I tell my wife how well it works. It is WAY better than the other two we owned in the past that were well known brands that just didn’t hold up. I love my Ninja Food Chopper. Also, for $20 this is a great value. It is super easy to clean too. Buy one...you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug in AZ

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL AND EFFICIENT PROCESSOR!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS LITTLE PROCESSOR HAS DYNAMITE POWER AND DOUBLE SETS OF BLADE TO MAKE IT WAY MORE EFFICIENT THATN ONE SET OF BLADE PROCESSORS. I BOUGHT IT TO CHOP ICE DOWN, AND IT IS POWERFUL TO DO THAT VERY WELL. I USE IT TO CHOP AND BLEND DRINKS AND I HAVE BEEN SO HAPPY WITH IT, I HAVE GIVEN IT AS GIFTS AND PURCHASED IT FOR MY VACATION HOME. CAN'T GO WRONG WITH THIS PROCESSOR. I HAVE PURCHASED 3 SO FAR, ALL ARE ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.author: DianeGhig

customer_reviews.title: after 3 months of usage the plastic start to crack
customer_reviews.text: I had a really bad experience with this product, I really enjoyed the small size and blending power but after 3 months of usage, the plastic cracked and I'm even afraid it arrived to my baby food. After reaching customer support, they offer me to get a new one at the shipping price of a new product which has no sense. I end up buying a new chopper with a metal bowl. Not going to buy any ninja product anymore due to very poor customer support.
customer_reviews.author: alon shiran

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and easy to use tool!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom for her kitchen appliances. The name, "Ninja Food Chopper," already has an incredible, outstanding resume. As a matter of fact, we have its blender product that we bought years ago and still use to this day without an issue! Anyhow, we love how powerful this tool is and how quickly we can chop either garlic, carrots, and other ingredients flawlessly. Definitely recommend to anyone who are looking for ingredient choppers.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these things cause I’m tired of chopping up garlic and onions and making my fingers smelly and eyes teary. My mom saw what I bought and we decided to test it out the same day we got the chopper (today). We threw in some onions and with just three presses of the button, all chopped to perfection! Now, we just placed an order for another one of these so my mom doesn’t try to steal mine! For $20, what this can do this a steal.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to chop nuts, garlic, onions, takes little counter space
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE Ninja blenders! Enjoying the larger one, with different sized bowls and blades, I needed to be able to have a chopper I could keep on the counter in my small kitchen. Trying to cut out sugar, dairy and gluten, I needed to have creative options for meals. Having a small chopper did the trick. This small Ninja has exceeded my expectations - easy to use and clean, I can chop to my heart's content, and make easy and quick meals, important given my busy schedule. I certainly recommend this Ninja, as well as the larger ones. It's turned the world of blenders on its head! Sandy Berenbaum, LCSW
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Berenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Cool item but lots of parts
customer_reviews.text: It does a really good job, But i don't like the fact there are many parts that you have to put together many times. Very powerful and not very loud. Does the job very well. Wish it was a little bigger. I'm just really picky and it takes longer than i want for a little job.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan VanNess

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I bought it chiefly to grind flax seeds and it just whirred them around and around. Didn't do squat. Use a coffee grinder instead like other posters recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: NEEENJA-CHOP
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It is a great food processor for one person meals! You drop the food in, press the top down in a few short bursts, and voila! You can chop things or straight up puree them for sauce. The blades are strong and sharp and haven't had any issues chopping anything, from mushy canned tomatoes to fresh basil leaves. The unit comes apart and is very easy to clean. I haven't had the issue with food getting stuck where the blade goes into the motor.
customer_reviews.author: R. Duzan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Motor shut down during first use. Good thing i only neede the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't all that m
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product but I've noticed that when taking off the top part it leaks everywhere if I dont move it to the sink quickly. Also I dont feel like the power is strong like other products I've used from ninja. It does the job but wish it had just a bit more power and didnt leak so much.
customer_reviews.author: RaeAnne Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, effective, difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Odd to me that the lid doesn’t lock in but it works. Used it for onions and it worked well, but the splatter on the underside of the motor was a pain to clean. It got into the groove where the motor fits on the base. Only other complaint is that it may be too powerful. It blasted a full onion into tiny fragments in like 5 seconds. Might not be great if you want a larger dice.
customer_reviews.author: DaveO

customer_reviews.title: Chops in seconds but not a slicer
customer_reviews.text: I meant to get a slicer. Had surgery and can't chop veggies for salad. Use for 2 seconds literally, and your veggies are chopped all right. I prefer slices but works great! Radishes and carrots? No problem. Incredibly fast results. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly Bear

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Chopper
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use this Chopper to chop vegetables. It does a pretty decent job. It definitely cuts down the time to cut a vegetable. However this Ninja Chopper does not cut the vegetables evenly. I will have small chunks of vegetables and these huge chunks of vegetables and if I keep trying to chop, it makes the rest of the veggies way too small. But for the price point you can use this as a food processor so I feel like it's pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Mish

customer_reviews.title: Easier than pulling out a cutting board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally because I wanted a small food prep and didn't want to pay cuisinart prices. This fit the bill and I figured for $20, if it sucks... It doesn't. It chops fast, it cleans up easy (dishwasher-safe), and the base can be stored in the fridge. It takes up a tiny amount of valuable kitchen storage room. Maybe you can't make mayonnaise in it (since you can't add things mid-chop), but for garlic, onions, and other "finely chopped" recipe requests it's a speed demon.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: At first I was so excited to have this product, however after 6-7 times of use it has stopped working. It was fast and quiet, no issue. But I don’t have any idea why all of sudden the mechanism just not turned on. Ninja has to fix the problem because that is my second chopper with the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Yevgeniya

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen Gadget Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest gadget in the kitchen and believe me, I have them all, cluttering up the cabinets. If you hate dragging out your electric food processor every time you want to chop an onion or make salsa, this is for you! BEWARE!! The blades are razor sharp so be extra careful when using and cleaning. I make chop salads in seconds; you can load it up with your favorite veggies and pull the cord 8 or 10 times and you're done.
customer_reviews.author: Ming

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding  Chopper
customer_reviews.text: Almonds, frozen and fresh spinach, broccoli, asparagus, chicken ... anything I can eat. It chops in a couple of one second bursts, in a few more seconds it chops extra-fine. And, in one minute or less it rinses visibly clean. Best chopper ever, except if I want 1/4” chunks, I still use a manual plunge chopper or knife. The Ninja is A tiger; not a brain surgeon.
customer_reviews.author: ABChwhite

customer_reviews.title: This is just the Best chopper!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with my purchase!!! I use this chopper almost every day and it is fabulous. The blades are so sharp they can chop even frozen items. I use it for so many things, vegetables, frozen fruits to make healthy desserts, salsas, even to make oat flour from oatmeal and it is a breeze to clean, just rinse off blades and container with water, that's it! Don't know how I lived without it....I would definitely buy this again and again and again!! It is a must have in my home!
customer_reviews.author: S. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: LOVED IT! Now I don't.
customer_reviews.text: This chopper is like four whirling blades of death to anything you can fit inside -- BUT -- after about a dozen or so uses, just fine chopping a little poached chicken for dog food, the plastic base has started to crack, just like in all the photos others have posted. This makes my very sad, because I loved this little thing while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Less Mess & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Less Mess: This product comes with a plastic cover that you can use so that the crumbs do not go into the corners of the lid. Easy to Use: You just put the lid on and it starts chopping right away because the lid is also what you use to start chopping. I love this product. Someone I know used it and I loved it, so I decided to get this one above all the others. Very successful product. I use it to blend salsas, grate cheese, and chop cookies/biscuits. Thank you seller! From, Michael and his fiance :)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Garner

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: You can shread anything in 2 seconds....onions...carrots....makes salsa in an instant.....ice too! I bought two...one for myself and one for a friend. They were 20 dollars when I bought them. I was buying a third as a gift just now and went elsewhere because it looks like here they are 39.00....still 20 elsewhere....pays to shop around.
customer_reviews.author: Emi

customer_reviews.title: Chops Fast
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes our new, handy chopper. He says that it is fast, thorough, and chops the food uniformly. He attributes the excellent results to the blades that are staggered along the shaft, which chops the food at the top, as well as at the bottom of the canister. So far, he's primarily used it for chopping his nuts, and also making pesto. As others have said, the blades are SHARP, which is why this little appliance works so well, but be careful!
customer_reviews.author: SMC

customer_reviews.title: It's like a mini ninja chopper
customer_reviews.text: It's like a mini ninja chopper. I have the Ninja complete kitchen system already but sometimes you you just want to chop up an onion or small stuff. This fits the bill. It's like they miniaturized the full sized ninja blades and put them in a small chopper. Just like the full size version, you have to watch how long your chopping or you'll end up with puree. Unless you want puree... then rest assured you'll get puree. Would purchase again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: kevinfTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cuts in a jiffy
customer_reviews.text: I cut vegetables in batches for the week and was finding time consuming to cut beetroot , carrot etc. This blender is so powerful, it cuts beetroot within 2 or 3 pulses. Others just take 1 pulse. I now use it to mince vegentables - carrot, onion, chilllies, to make salsa, to make avacado shakes. It is turning out to be my fave kitchen gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Sabbysou

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy! I have used it multiple times and it gets the job done pretty quick and doesn’t leave large pieces untouched. I made a real strawberry lemon slush for my kid!!! Be very careful the blades are really sharp, my 7 yr old grabbed it and cut his finger before I could say NO that’s sharp, of course the design is intriguing to a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Love conquers all

customer_reviews.title: Nutty experience
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this to chop peanuts small enough for peanut butter, and while it did chop most of the peanuts after shaking it around a few times, it ultimately didn't chop them finely enough for my liking. I think I'll just use it on veggies and fruits from now on...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Really Like This One
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I'm still using it, I don't know when I purchased it but it been some years. You only need to push the button once or twice depending on how much you put in. It's a great time and energy saver. I can whip up potato salad in half the time. I still hand cut the potatoes but everything else gets chopped in the Ninja.
customer_reviews.author: Shalonn

customer_reviews.title: Overall is good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but not for cleaning, especially when you used it for meat. Also, it is extremely hard for the fat meat, such as, pork belly. But good for all other stuff. Blending power is good though. Overall is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Andy-L

customer_reviews.title: AVOID PLASTIC!!!
customer_reviews.text: AVOID PLASTIC!!! I was skeptical to buy this product because plastics are so harmful, cheap and breakable. It worked great until I saw small chunks of plastic taken out of the bowl. We have been INGESTING PLASTIC in our chopped food. Ninja, please get with the program and make so non-toxic glass or stainless steel bowls/appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Shanfan

customer_reviews.title: Works for a while
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding at first. Powerful machine, cuts everything to pieces the first few months. However after 3 months of daily use started to lose power and make a terrible noise. Top part that needs to be push to star the machine started also to get stuck after a few months. I have all ninja kitchen equipment very dissatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny100

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day!
customer_reviews.text: This food chopper gets used every day at my house. I’ve had it for several months now and the blades stay sharp. I still chop my tomatoes by hand because this chopper tends to liquify them. I like the fact that it has two levels of blades, which helps to chop evenly. I have a Magic Bullet but it doesn’t work as well as this.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Good for making baby food
customer_reviews.text: Mainly used for baby food preparation and also single-serve (or half-serve) frozen fruit smoothie (tried raspberry, strawberry, etc). I can understand that other comments complained about the cleaning of the motorhead (the place connecting to the blade) since when you blend with some liquid the puree will get into the bottom part of the motor. I am using a very damp (almost dripping) cloth to clean it and so far it works well. But still hope there would be a better design on this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Xie

customer_reviews.title: Life made easy! Super efficient for cheap price
customer_reviews.text: I have used hand choppers in past, either they don’t work or get stuck after few uses. Ninja is smooth, fast and quick. Easy to put together, easy to wash. Chopping onion literally takes 4-5sec. I am an Indian and I use onions in almost all recipes I make, so the amount of time I spend in doing that use to be a lot. Ninja has made my life so easy. Saves so much TIME. Perfect size- you can chop 2onions easily with Ninja. With the hand chopper I hand to do the chopping in batches as it was too small and because I had to pull it, it would take an extra effort.
customer_reviews.author: Nams

customer_reviews.title: will work only for a few days
customer_reviews.text: After using this chopper for a few days it stopped working, there was no power in the unit. It worked very well in the beginning but very soon it stopped working. I earlier used a Black and Decker chopper and it lasted forever, I had to buy the Ninja as the blades for my old Black and Decker chopper were not in great condition and the model got discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy! Bought it primarily for pesto making, and it does a great job blending enough to get the right consistency. It can overheat on occasion, so it’s best to run it for 15 or 20 seconds at a time rather than continuously. The only thing I don’t love is that the top with the motor doesn’t stand up on its own so you have to lay it on its side when not in use. Not really a big deal at all, and really that’s the only thing I can think of that I’d change. Super affordable for the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great but may not last long.
customer_reviews.text: Quickly whips up smoothies. I use it almost every day. I do start with crushed ice so don't know how it would do with whole cubes. My only complaint is that it appears to be cracking on the bottom and I have had it a little over a month. I don't know how long it will last before it starts to leak. I have only washed it by hand so I don't know how it would hold up in a dishwasher either.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly McNeilly

customer_reviews.title: I blend a red pepper and an onion together to mix into meatloaf to give it a sweet taste, and she doesn't even notice
customer_reviews.text: this thing has made cooking at home so convenient at a reasonable price. I can make fresh baby food for my 8 month old son in seconds. I can puree veggies to put in sauces so my 4 year old doesn't realize she eating healthy food. I blend a red pepper and an onion together to mix into meatloaf to give it a sweet taste, and she doesn't even notice. But if I were to dice them, she would refuse the whole meal. Guacamole, salsa, riced cauliflower, homemade bbq sauce, etc. all done nearly instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Way better than kitchen aid, third of the price
customer_reviews.text: So far it works better than any blender or processor I’ve had. Blows the kitchen aid I had out of the water ($55) processor. Plus the kitchen aid looked old and couldn’t Ben used with out extreme dexterity. This has the most simple use. Motors on top which allows anyone to use safely whether young or old. No locking mechanism just push and go. Blade design and sharpness is out of this world. Never seen a blender come sharpened like a Samaria sword lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonoone Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this little Ninja
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Ninja Express Chop - same model. I used the other one so much it was getting a little worn, although still usable. I live alone so the smaller size suits suits me well. I have always been amazed at how powerful it is for such a small motor and how well it processes everything, even the vegan cheeses I make. I also have the high speed blender and processor by Ninja, which I absolutely love (and in my opinion I would use Ninja over Vitamix any day), but I tend to use this smaller Ninja much more often for processing because of its convenience. When this one wears out I will definitely get another. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another great Ninja product
customer_reviews.text: We have a few Ninja products and this one did not disappoint. It cut our vegetables flawlessly. It's especially useful for chopping onions so that you don't end up crying.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gadget for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ninja, which I use for smoothies. It works pretty well. I think though, that a 20 ounce would be a bit better for smoothies. When blending, the mixture works its way up to the motor attachment, which cannot be washed with water. So, I take a toothpick and gently remove what gets in there, to clean it out. All in all, I think it's a good product, but can be improved a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Easily grated a piece of Parmesan. Buy it. No brainer.
customer_reviews.text: I am a kitchen tool fanatic. This little baby is awesome. I love the two-tier blades. Chops nuts to any size desired. Makes sauces in no time. I broke up the Parmesan into chunks. Possibly, I did not need to do so, but I was concerned I might dull the blades...which are incredibly sharp. I have four different choppers and they don't hold a candle to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Dillie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect To Chop Vegetables!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for me! I use it to chop lettuce, cabbage, spring mix, kale, carrots, hard (but very VERY tiny) pellets. I saw comments mentioning food getting stuck inside a hole on the machine. So far no food has gotten stuck, but I’m confident that a tooth pick or another small object could easily clean this out. So far I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: A good machine but not perfect for chopping.
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up on a deal of the day for 16$ roughly so I’ll say I am happy for the price I spent I would never find anything close. However, I was ideally looking for this to chop veggies but I would say it more minces and blends. I made salsa today, my first time using it, it was easy to set up, use and clean BUT my salsa wasn’t as chunky and had a higher water content from the break down of the tomatoes. Still though I had fresh salsa in five minutes that’s tasty and satisfying so still a win in my book. I could see this being great making baby food!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Ninja blades for about 5 years and I have zero complaints. I remember being initially drawn in by one of their promotional videos that showed the blades turning solid ice cubes into snow. When I purchased my first set, I definitely tried it and it actually worked! These blades are powerful and long-lasting. It is true that sometimes the cleanup can be slightly frustrating because some stuff gets stuck in the little circle-shaped gap where the electronic mechanism connects to the blades, but it's only a minor inconvenience. I highly recommend you buy Ninja if you're looking for a solid food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Love This Chopper!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had several black & decker choppers thru the years. Finally got a Ninja chopper after reading many great reviews, and I am in love with it! Chops fast, easy to clean, and small enough to store anywhere yet big enough to handle jobs like salsa. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a compact chopper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The tiered three blades cut quickly with minimal large pieces left
customer_reviews.text: Holding on to unit is difficult for smaller hands like mine....but once in place stays where it should be....very sensitive cutter....carrots,peppers,onions,celery just needed a quick pulse or two...made nice puree out of strawberries for mix in yogurt...plug seems hard to plug into outlet...
customer_reviews.author: cannabina

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have!
customer_reviews.text: This little gem is a definite keeper! I own a large-capacity food processor, but this little Ninja is PERFECT for chopping just a small amount of something. It handles carrots, onions, and other veggies with no problem whatsoever. It's a Ninja! It's fast! It completely chops every bit of whatever -- NO chunks! Super-easy cleanup! Occupies precious little space! What more could anyone want? This is a definite must-have in EVERY kitchen! Okay -- in MY kitchen. LOVE it! BOTTOM LINE: Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: C. HawkinsTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: After a lot of choppers of similar price this is the best
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of choppers of similar price which lasted almost nothing, and never did a good chopping this is the best I tried Not only I have been using it almost every day but I even wash it in the dishwasher, not a scratch until now, also I am being tempted to find out the cost of the chopping vase, it is hermetic and it has a small cap so you can store the food in it afterwards, highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Elian

product_meta.title: Ninja Food Chopper Express Chop with 200-Watt, 16-Ounce Bowl for Mincing, Chopping, Grinding, Blending and Meal Prep (NJ110GR)
product_meta.description:
Color:Gray

NINJA EXPRESS CHOP PROFESSIONAL WITH PATENTED NINJA BLADE TECHNOLOGY
Handle any job with the Ninja Express Chop Professional which minces, dices, chops, blends, and purees fresh ingredients evenly in the 16 oz (2 cup) chopper bowl for perfect results every time 

PULSE TECHNOLOGY
The ergonomic 200-watt power pod features a large chrome pulsing button for ultimate control and consistent results.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
A no-slip base and splashguard on the chopper bowl keeps everything steady and clean. For added convenience, a storage lid is included to keep your food fresh and all removable parts are dishwasher-safe.


NINJA EXPRESS CHOP PROFESSIONAL (NJ110GR)
 * Model - NJ110GR 
 * Power - 200 Watts 
 * Speeds - Pulse Technology 
 * Chopper Bowl Capacity - 16 oz. (2 cups) 
 * Stacked Blade Technology - 4 blade set 
 * Warranty - 1 Year 
 * BPA Free 
 * Dishwasher Safe

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
200 Watt Power Pod, 16 oz Chopper Bowl, 4- blade set, Chopper Splash Guard, Chopper Storage Lid

Ninja Master Prep FamilyExpress Chop Professional (NJ110GR)Master Prep with 400 Watts (QB900B)Master Prep with 450 Watts (QB1000)Master Prep Professional (QB1004)400 Watts✓450 Watts✓✓16 oz Chopper Bowl✓✓✓✓48 oz Prep Pitcher✓✓✓40 oz Prep Bowl✓Chrome Button on Power Pod✓✓✓Stacked Blade Technology✓✓✓✓Storage Lid(s)✓✓✓✓ 

BRAND STORY
By Ninja
feature_bullets: Effortlessly mince, chop, grind and blend a variety of ingredients for easy meal preparation or final touches
Perfect for garlic, onion, zest, spices, herbs, cheese, bacon crumbles, nut chopping, chocolate, dressings, sauces and spreads
Ergonomic designed power head is easy to handle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars9,321 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
